content:
Bhokarhedi

Bhokarhedi is a town and a nagar panchayat in Muzaffarnagar district  in the state of Uttar Pradesh, India.

Demographics
As of 2001[update] India census,{"citetype": "web", "url": "http://www.censusindia.net/results/town.php?stad=A&state5=999", "title": "Census of India 2001: Data from the 2001 Census, including cities, villages and towns  (Provisional)", "publisher": "Census Commission of India", "accessdate": "2008-11-01", "archiveurl": "https://web.archive.org/web/20040616075334/http://www.censusindia.net/results/town.php?stad=A&state5=999", "archivedate": "2004-06-16"} Bhokarhedi had a population of 15,973. Males constitute 54% of the population and females 46%. Bhokarhedi has an average literacy rate of 51%, lower than the national average of 59.5%; with male literacy of 59% and female literacy of 41%. 17% of the population is under 6 years of age.
Timur or Tamarlane discusses a battle he fought with Hindu Jat warriors here while going to Hardwar during 1398-1399 campaign in  January 1399.There are 12 wards in Bhokerhadi{lokupura uttari,lokupura dakshani,baheda patti,klallan,pathanan,kuwa patti,main bazar,nai basti,harizan chowk,nehru chowk,shubash chowk and seth puri}.Main crop produce in bhokerdadi is sugarcane.
